definitions.definition: Buying and selling of goods and services on a market.
A particular instance of buying or selling.
definitions.example: I did no trades with them once the rumors started.

definitions.definition: An instance of bartering items in exchange for one another.
Those who perform a particular kind of skilled work.
definitions.example: The skilled trades were the first to organize modern labor unions.

definitions.definition: Those engaged in an industry or group of related industries.
definitions.example: It is not a retail showroom. It is only for the trade.

definitions.definition: The skilled practice of a practical occupation.
definitions.example: He learned his trade as an apprentice.

definitions.definition: An occupation in the secondary sector, as opposed to an agricultural, professional or military one.
definitions.example: After failing his entrance exams, he decided to go into a trade.

definitions.definition: The business given to a commercial establishment by its customers.
definitions.example: Even before noon there was considerable trade.

definitions.definition: (chiefly in the plural) Steady winds blowing from east to west above and below the equator.
definitions.example: They rode the trades going west.

definitions.definition: (only as plural) A publication intended for participants in an industry or related group of industries.
definitions.example: Rumors about layoffs are all over the trades.

definitions.definition: A brief sexual encounter.
definitions.example: Josh picked up some trade last night.

definitions.definition: Instruments of any occupation.
Refuse or rubbish from a mine.
A track or trail; a way; a path; passage.
Course; custom; practice; occupation.
To engage in trade.
To be traded at a certain price or under certain conditions.
To give (something) in exchange for.
definitions.example: Will you trade your precious watch for my earring?

definitions.definition: To give someone a plant and receive a different one in return.
To do business; offer for sale as for one's livelihood.
To have dealings; to be concerned or associated (with).
Steady winds blowing from east to west above and below the equator.
definitions.example: They rode the trades going west.

definitions.definition: A publication intended for participants in an industry or related group of industries.
definitions.example: Rumors about layoffs are all over the trades.
